group.groupDescription: This group contains functions related to single media server

function.name: execAction
function.description: Execute business action. Action data should bin in a internal binary format. This method is going to be refactor at next version.

result.caption: Return XML with 'OK' message or error code

function.name: events
function.description: Returns event log

param.name: from
param.description: Start of time period at ms since 1.1.1970 (UTC format).

param.name: to
param.description: End of time period at ms since 1.1.1970 (UTC format).

result.caption: Return media server event log in proprietary binary format

function.name: doCameraDiagnosticsStep
function.description: Performs camera diagnostics.

value.name: cameraAvailability
value.description: Checks if camera is accessible from media server

value.name: mediaStreamAvailability
value.description: Checks if camera media stream can be opened

function.name: setCameraParam
function.description: Sets values of several camera parameters. This parameters are used on a advanced Tab in camera settings. For instance: brigthness, contrast e.t.c.

param.name: <any name>
param.description: Parameter for camera to set. Request can contains one or more parameters to set.

result.caption: Returns OK if all parameters have been set, otherwise returns error 500 (Internal server error) and result of setting for every param.

function.name: getCameraParam
function.description: Read camera parameters. For instance: brigthness, contrast e.t.c. Parameters to read should be specified.

param.name: <any name>
param.description: Parameter name to read. Request can contains one or more parameters.

result.caption: Returns required parameter values in form of paramName=paramValue, each param on new line

function.name: image
function.description: Return image from camera

param.name: time
param.description: required image time. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. Date format is auto detected. Also, addition special values are allowed.

value.name: NOW
value.description: Live position (no frame is returned if camera is offline

value.name: LATEST
value.description: last frame from camera (return live position or last frame from archive if camera is offline)

param.name: method
param.description: Parameter defines method to search frame inside GOP structure. Default value 'before'. Parameter not used for Motion jpeg video codec.

value.name: before
value.description: Returns nearest I-frame before specified time.

value.name: after
value.description: Returns nearest I-frame after specified time.

value.name: exact
value.description: Get image for exact time position. It required more CPU.

param.name: height
param.description: Required image height. By default image have same size as source video stream.

param.name: width
param.description: Required image width. By default image have same size as source video stream. If only width or height is specified other parameter is auto detected. Video aspect ratio is not changed.

function.name: showLog
function.description: Returns tail of the server log file

result.caption: Tail of the server log file in text format

function.name: manualCamera/search
function.description: Search cameras in manual mode

param.name: start_ip
param.description: First ip address in range to scan.

param.name: end_ip
param.description: Last ip address in range to scan.

param.name: port
param.description: Camera(s) port to chek. Port is autodetected if parameter is absent.

result.caption: XML with camera names, manufacturers and urls.

function.name: manualCamera/status
function.description: Get manual addition progress.

function.name: manualCamera/stop
function.description: Stop manual addition progress.

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: manualCamera/add
function.description: Manual add camera(s). If several cameras are added, parameters 'url' and 'manufacturer' must be defined several times.

param.name: url
param.description: Camera url returned by scan request.

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: ping
function.description: Ping the server

function.name: pingSystem
function.description: Ping the system.

result.caption: JSON with error code, error string and module information in case of successfull ping. Error string could be empty in case of successful ping, "FAIL" if the specified system is unrechable or there is no any system, "UNAUTHORIZED" if the authentification credentials are invalid, and "INCOMPATIBLE" if the found system has incompatible version or different customization.

function.name: ptz/move
function.description: Start camera moving.

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: ptz/stop
function.description: Stop camera moving.

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: ptz/moveTo
function.description: Go to absolute position

param.name: xPos
param.description: Go to absolute X position in range [-1..+1]

param.name: yPos
param.description: Go to absolute Y position in range [-1..+1]

param.name: zoomPos
param.description: Go to absolute zoom position in range [-1..+1]

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: ptz/getPosition
function.description: Return current camera position.

result.caption: XML with camera position or error code.

function.name: ptz/calibrate
function.description: calibrate moving speed (addition speed coeff)

result.caption: XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: ptz/getCalibrate
function.description: Read current calibration settings

function.name: ptz/getSpaceMapper
function.description: return JSON-serialized PTZ space mapper. This information contains curves for camera FOV and zoom position and camera moving ranges. This information used in advanced PTZ mode.

function.name: rebuildArchive
function.description: Start or stop rebuilding of media server archive.

result.caption: Rebuild progress if no input param specified or XML with OK message or error code.

function.name: RecordedTimePeriods
function.description: Recorded chunk info by specified cameras.

param.name: physicalId
param.description: Camera unique ID. Parameter can be used several times to define a list of cameras.

param.name: startTime
param.description: Start time of a time interval. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. format is auto detected.

param.name: endTime
param.description: End time of a time interval. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. format is auto detected.

param.name: motionRegions
param.description: Match motion on a video by specified rect. Parameter can be used several times.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Allowed values: 'json', 'xml', 'txt', 'bin'. Default value 'json'

param.name: detail
param.description: Chunk detail level, in microseconds. Time periods/chunks that are shorter than the detail level are discarded. You can use detail level as amount of microseconds per screen pixel.

result.caption: Chunks data in requested format. Chunks are merged for all requested cameras. Time and duration defined in UTC milliseconds.

function.name: statistics
function.description: Returns server info: CPU usage, HDD usage e.t.c.

function.name: storageSpace
function.description: Returns a list of all server storages.

function.name: storageStatus
function.description: Check if specified folder can be used as media server storage.

result.caption: JSON data. 'OK' if specified folder may be used for writing on mediaServer. Otherwise returns 'FAIL'

function.name: gettime
function.description: Returns server UTC time and time zone

function.name: activateLicense
function.description: Activate new license and return license json data if success

function.name: installUpdate
function.description: Updates server by the package contained in POST body

function.name: onEvent
function.description: Process business event from external system. Reserved for future use.

function.name: discoveredPeers
function.description: Returns a list of the discovered peers.

result.caption: JSON with a list of the discovered peers

function.name: restart
function.description: Restart the server.

function.name: installUpdate
function.description: Install update from zip package wich should be in the request body.

function.name: moduleInformation
function.description: Get information about the server.

function.name: moduleInformationAuthenticated
function.description: The same as moduleInformation but requires authentication. Useful to test connectibility.

function.name: routingInformation/connections
function.description: Get all connections established in the current system.

function.name: routingInformation/cachedRoutes
function.description: Get a list of cached routes.

function.name: routingInformation/routeTo
function.description: Get the shortest route to the specified peer.

param.name: target
param.description: GUID or host:port of the target.

function.name: configure
function.description: Configure server parameters.

param.name: systemName
param.description: New system name for the server.

param.name: wholeSystem
param.description: Flag shows if the specified system name must be set to the all servers in the system.

result.caption: JSON with error code and flag "restartNeeded" that shows if the server must be restarted to apply settings. Error string contains a hint to identify a problem: SYSTEM_NAME, PORT or PASSWORD.

function.name: mergeSystems
function.description: Merge two systems.

param.name: url
param.description: URL of one server in the system to join.

param.name: password
param.description: Admin password of the target system.

value.name: true
value.description: The current system will get system name and admin password of the target system.

value.name: false
value.description: The target system will get system name and admin password of the current system.

result.caption: JSON with error code and error string. Error string could be empty in case of successful ping, "FAIL" if the specified system is unrechable or there is no any system, "UNAUTHORIZED" if the authentification credentials are invalid, "INCOMPATIBLE" if the found system has incompatible version or different customization, and "BACKUP_ERROR" if database backup could not been created.

function.name: backupDatabase
function.description: Backup server database.

group.groupDescription: This group contains functions related to whole system (all media servers).

function.name: getResourceTypes
function.description: Read all resource types. Resource type contain object type such as 'Server', 'Camera' e.t.c. Also, reosource types contain addition information for cameras such as maximum fps, resolution e.t.c

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getResourceParams
function.description: Read resource (camera, user or server) addition parameters (camera firmware version e.t.c). List of parameters depends of resource type.

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getMediaServersEx
function.description: Return media server list

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getCamerasEx
function.description: Read camera list

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

result.caption: Returns camera list data formatted in a requested format

attribute.name: addParams
attribute.description: List of addition parameters for camera. This list can contain such information as full ONVIF url, camera maximum fps e.t.c

attribute.name: audioEnabled
attribute.description: Media server will push audio stream from a camera if parameter is true

attribute.name: controlEnabled
attribute.description: Media server will manage camera (change resolution, fps, create profiles e.t.c) if parameter if true

attribute.name: dewarpingParams
attribute.description: Json string with devarping parameters

attribute.name: groupId
attribute.description: Internal group identifier. It is used for grouping channels for multu-channels cameras together.

attribute.name: groupName
attribute.description: Group name. This name can be changed by user

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Object ID. All ID for all objects in a system is GUIDs

attribute.name: login
attribute.description: Login for camera authentication

attribute.name: mac
attribute.description: camera MAC address

attribute.name: manuallyAdded
attribute.description: True if user added camera manually

attribute.name: maxArchiveDays
attribute.description: Maxumum archive duration in days for this camera. If value less or equal to zerro, it is not used

attribute.name: minArchiveDays
attribute.description: Minimum archive duration in days for this camera. If value less or equal to zerro, it is not used

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Camera model

attribute.name: motionMask
attribute.description: Camera's motion mask. This string defines several rects via ':' delimeter. Each rect is described by 5 digits: sensitivity, x,y(for left top corner), width, height

attribute.name: motionType
attribute.description: If value is 'MT_SoftwareGrid' then media server determine mition, otherwise camera built-in motion will be used

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Camera name

attribute.name: parentId
attribute.description: Camera's server ID

attribute.name: physicalId
attribute.description: Camera unique identifier. This identifier is used in all requests related to a camera. For instance, in RTSP requests

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: Password for camera authentication

attribute.name: scheduleEnabled
attribute.description: Do record camera archive if true

attribute.name: scheduleTasks
attribute.description: List of 'scheduleTask' objects with camera recording schedule.

attribute.name: secondaryStreamQuality
attribute.description: Secondary stream quality. Possible values:'SSQualityLow', 'SSQualityMedium', 'SSQualityHigh', 'SSQualityDontUse'

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Camera status. Possible values are: 'Offline', 'Online', 'Recording'

attribute.name: statusFlags
attribute.description: Usually this field is zerro. Non zerro value is used to mark that a lot of network issues was occured with this camera

attribute.name: typeId
attribute.description: Guid with camera's type. Camera's type can describe predefined information such as camera maximum resolution, fps e.t.c. Detailed type information can be obtained via 'getResourceTypes' request.

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: Camera plain ip address or full http url if camera was added manually. Also, for multichannel encoders full url is used

attribute.name: vendor
attribute.description: Camera manufacturer

function.name: getCameraHistoryItems
function.description: Read information about which server hold camera in some time period. This information is used for archive play if camera was moved from one media server to another.

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getCameraBookmarkTags
function.description: Reserved for future use

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getBusinessRules
function.description: Return business rules

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getUsers
function.description: Return users registered in the system. User's password contain MD5 hash data with salt

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getVideowalls
function.description: Return list of video walls

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getLayouts
function.description: Return list of user layout

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: listDirectory
function.description: Return list of folders and files in a virtual FS stored inside database. This function is used to add files (such audio for nitifications) to database.

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

param.name: folder
param.description: Folder name in a virtual FS

function.name: getStoredFile
function.description: Read file data from a virtual FS

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getSettings
function.description: Read general system settings such as email address e.t.c

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getCurrentTime
function.description: Read current time

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getFullInfo
function.description: Read all data such as all media servers, cameras, users e.t.c

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

function.name: getLicenses
function.description: Read license list

value.name: csv
value.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

group.groupDescription: This group contains information about media server RTSP api. RTSP api is accessible on the same port as HTTP requests. To request video for camera use:

function.name: <physicalId>
function.description: Open RTSP video from a camera. It is not an exact method name. It means that RTSP url may contain any camera unique ID. For instance: rtsp://<server_ip>:<port>/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p

param.name: pos
param.description: By default media server opens camera from live position. This parameter defines position in an archive in microseconds in a UTC format. Position can be passed via standard RTSP attribute as well as via URL parameter

param.name: resolution
param.description: Turn on video transcoding to the specified resolution. Resolution string either may contain width and height (for instance 320x240) or height only (for instance 240p)

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree. If parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog. Parameter take place if video transcoding is activated (parameter codec and/or parameter resolution are presents.)

param.name: codec
param.description: Defines video codec used for transcoding. Default value H263.

group.groupDescription: This group contains information about accessing server's media streams with HLS protocol. This protocol is supported by iOS-based devices (iPhone, iPad). HLS is available on the same port as HTTP and RTSP. To request video use:

function.name: <physicalId>
function.description: Url format for opening camera stream with HLS: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/<physicalId>.m3u

param.name: startDatetime
param.description: Date format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSTZD (e.g., 1997-07-16T19:20:30+01:00). If present, camera archive is opened on specified position

param.name: startTimestamp
param.description: Same as <startDatetime>, but contains number of micro seconds from epoch (1970-01-01 00:00 UTC)

param.name: hi
param.description: If specified, only hi quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

param.name: lo
param.description: If specified, only low quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

group.groupDescription: Progressive downloading is method of receiving media stream using HTTP protocol. Codec and stream format can be specified in url parameters. Live stream and archive can be downloaded. If required, media stream transcoding is performed on-the-fly

function.name: <physicalId>
function.description: Url format: http://<server_ip>:<port>/media/<physicalId>.<format> Stream format can be one of following: webm, mpegts, mp4, 3gp, mpjpeg (motion jpeg)

param.name: resolution
param.description: Video stream resolution. Example: 720x576, 1920x1080, 720p, 1080p. By default, 640x480 is used

param.name: pos
param.description: If present and not equal to <now>, specifies archive stream start positions in milliseconds from epoch (1970-01-01 00:00, UTC). Otherwise, LIVE stream is provided

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree. If parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog
